item.title: Stress (Ударение)
item.description: Interests Catalógus or catálogus? The latter is correct (traceable to the Greek), but no one looks strangely if you say catalógus. In Russian, emphasis is more important. It can determine both the pronunciation of a word (an stressed syllable sometimes sounds very different from an unstressed one) and its spelling.

item.title: Six Cases
item.description: The Six Cases Nominative, genitive, dative, accusative, instrumental, and locative. The six Russian grammatical cases (in English: cases, in Russian падежи) affect words, names, numbers—basically everything, and all the time. Case / Case Name Падеж nominative / nominative имени́тельный genitive / genitive роди́тельный dative / dative да́тельный accusative / accusative вини́тельный instrumental / instrumental твори́тельный locative / prepositional предло́жный (Abbreviations: Им, Рд, Дт, Вн, Тв, Пр – sometimes a single letter is used)
